TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SecureMailboxAddress extends MimeKit.MailboxAddress

Docs.summary: A secure mailbox address which includes a fingerprint for a certificate.

remarks.para: When signing or encrypting a message, it is necessary to look up the X.509 certificate in order to do the actual sign or encrypt operation. One way of accomplishing this is to use the email address of sender or recipient as a unique identifier. However, a better approach is to use the fingerprint (or 'thumbprint' in Microsoft parlance) of the user's certificate.

MemberSignature.Value: public SecureMailboxAddress (string name, string address, string fingerprint);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, string address, string fingerprint) cil managed

Docs.param: The fingerprint of the certificate belonging to the owner of the mailbox.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Docs.remarks: Creates a new with the specified fingerprint.

Docs.summary: Gets the fingerprint of the certificate and/or key to use for signing or encrypting.
Docs.remarks: A fingerprint is a SHA-1 hash of the raw certificate data and is often used as a unique identifier for a particular certificate in a certificate store.
